metadata.title: MRI Brain Interpretation (Basic)
metadata.description: Rubric for basic MRI brain interpretation skills.
metadata.author: Casewise System

categories.name: MRI Brain Assessment
categories.description: Core components of MRI brain interpretation.

criteria.name: Sequence Identification
criteria.description: Identifies and utilizes appropriate MRI sequences for interpretation.
criteria.rationale: Proper sequence identification is fundamental to accurate MRI interpretation.

scoring_guide.0: No mention of sequences or incorrect sequence identification
scoring_guide.1: Mentions some sequences but incomplete identification
scoring_guide.2: Comprehensive identification and utilization of all relevant sequences

criteria.name: Anatomical Assessment
criteria.description: Systematic evaluation of brain anatomy and symmetry.
criteria.rationale: Comprehensive anatomical assessment is essential for detecting structural abnormalities.

scoring_guide.1: Partial anatomical evaluation or missing key structures
scoring_guide.2: Complete evaluation of all major anatomical structures and symmetry

criteria.name: Pathology Detection
criteria.description: Identifies and characterizes brain pathology across sequences.
criteria.rationale: Accurate pathology detection is critical for diagnosis and treatment planning.

scoring_guide.0: No pathology identified or missed significant findings
scoring_guide.1: Identifies some pathology but incomplete characterization
scoring_guide.2: Comprehensive identification and characterization of all pathology

criteria.name: Signal Analysis
criteria.description: Analyzes signal characteristics across different sequences.
criteria.rationale: Signal analysis across sequences is crucial for accurate diagnosis and differential.

scoring_guide.1: Basic signal analysis without comprehensive evaluation
scoring_guide.2: Detailed signal analysis across all relevant sequences

criteria.name: Differential Diagnosis
criteria.description: Provides appropriate differential diagnosis based on imaging findings.
criteria.rationale: Focused differential diagnosis guides further workup and management decisions.

scoring_guide.1: General differential without prioritization or clinical correlation
scoring_guide.2: Prioritized differential with clinical correlation and reasoning

criteria.name: Clinical Correlation and Recommendations
criteria.description: Provides clinical correlation and appropriate recommendations.
criteria.rationale: Clinical correlation and recommendations guide patient management and follow-up.

scoring_guide.2: Specific recommendations with clinical correlation and follow-up
